oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Lone Star Cafe Show - Storytellers and Tom T. Hall
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is from the Lone Star Cafe live show. The tape features live performances from: the Storytellers (musical group) and Tom T. Hall (musician). The Lone Star Cafe show is presented by Mort Cooperman, Bill McGivney and the WHN radio network. The recording of Tom T. Hall is from April 27, 1979.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Storytellers; Tom T. Hall
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) An unidentified host introduces the Lone Star Cafe and the Storytellers -- (01:07) Damn Good Band [poor recording] (Storytellers) -- (04:16) Nervous Pool Crawl [unconfirmed] (Storytellers) -- (06:40) An unidentified host introduces Tom T. Hall -- (07:20) Country Is (Tom T. Hall) -- (09:24) Hall looks for his friends in the crowd, and Hall reflects on working in a cemetery -- (11:09) Ballad of Forty Dollars (Tom T. Hall) -- (14:07) Hall reflects on a Penthouse Magazine article while listing his friends in the audience -- (15:56) The Year That Clayton Delaney Died (Tom T. Hall) -- (18:50) Hall reflects on growing up in Kentucky -- (20:02) Unidentified banjo tune (Tom T. Hall) -- (23:42) I Know You're Married (But I Love You Still) (Tom T. Hall) -- (26:11) Hall pays tribute to the various artists that recorded his songs -- (27:29) Unidentified tune (Tom T. Hall) -- (31:21) I Can't Stop Loving You (Tom T. Hall) -- (35:00) Hall addresses more guests in the crowd -- (36:15) I Like Beer (Tom T. Hall) -- (39:11) Hall addresses the crowd and WHN -- (40:52) I Love (Tom T. Hall) -- (44:03) Mr. Bojangles (Tom T. Hall) -- (49:01) Old Dogs, Children, and Watermelon Wine (Tom T. Hall) -- (53:39) Hall introduces a member of the crowd, and Hall brings multiple members of the crowd on to the stage -- (55:54) Amazing Grace (Tom T. Hall) -- (59:18) Unidentified tune (Tom T. Hall) -- (1:01:53) Down on the Rio Grande [featuring unidentified host] [incomplete] (Johnny Rodriguez)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Storytellers (musical group); Hall, Tom T.;
